history.content:
First, note that fall 2016 was prof. niknejad's first time in a while teaching 105, and he told us that he would change things a bit for future classes.  For instance, initially hw's took >20hrs, prelabs >10 hrs to complete, but he reduced that considerably halfway through after student feedback: he combined prelabs with the hw, for a reasonable 10ish hrs total of work a week (I worked with a friend on hw/lab). Also, the prelabs are done with Cadence Virtuoso, which takes some time to get used to, though it will become a lifesaver later on.  Labs themselves can be finished during the lab period, with maybe 30 min extra needed occasionally.

In general, Niknejad focused much more on circuits than device physics (~75-25 split).  (taking 130 concurrently will make the device physics trivial). The beginning of the class will be time-consuming since you will have to solve the circuits with kvl/kcl (use mathematica to do the algebra.  I wish I knew about this before) to build intuition.  Eventually you'll get an aha! moment and be able to tell what a circuit (that used to take you 5 hrs) is doing at a glance, in mere seconds.  Its kinda beautiful really, though it'll still take now ~7ish hrs a week since the problems get much harder (from 1 transistor to many, with frequency response, swing, biasing, etc).  
In sum: It'll probably start off with about 10-15 hrs of work, and then once things click,  it will take half the time. The midterm & final were easy/reasonable once this happens (unfortunately for me, this happened after the midterm).  My advice would be to really pay attention & ask many questions during the two weeks where he first introduces single & multistage amplifiers so that that aha moment happens. If you don't put in the effort during these 2 weeks you will never gain the intuition and the class will be hell.  But if you do, you will get the aha moment eventually, and then the class will be extremely rewarding/beautiful/fun.  Sorry I wrote a lot, but I hope you enjoy 105 :)

children.subject: OP, are you taking 105 this semester?

history.content:
Looking for answers from people who took ee105 in Fall 2016.

Anything about homeworks, labs, midterm(s), and final would be greatly appreciated.
history.subject: What's the workload like for ee105?
